author: Mike Robinson
method: Heat some olive oil in a pan and fry the ginger, garlic and chopped chilli.   Add the zest and juice of the lime and pour in the soy sauce.  Add the maple syrup and cook for 1 minute or until reduced and sticky.   Meanwhile, pan-fry the two pieces of salmon for 2 minutes each side in a hot griddle pan.   When the sauce is reduced add the salmon to the teriyaki sauce frying pan.   Cook and drain the noodles, adding the sesame oil, seasoning and coriander and a squeeze of lime.  Serve the salmon on a bed of noodles with more chopped coriander.
ingredients: 2 salmon fillets,  4-5 tbsp dark soy sauce,  1 lime, zest and juice,  1 small chilli,  2 tbsp maple syrup,  1 fat garlic clove, finely chopped ,  1 chunk of ginger, finely chopped ,  1 sheet of egg noodles,  bunch of coriander, chopped,  1 tbsp sesame oil,  extra lime juice
